Description: Body sherd of Attic black-figured pottery open vase, dinos or krater; interior glazed; outside: black-figure decoration consisting part of lotus and palmette chain with added red; below, black line above black area preserved.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by Royal Ontario Museum, Toronto. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Also illustrated in Boardman, The Greeks Overseas (1980) fig. 142. The illustration in CVA is upside-down.
Bibliographic references: CVA Toronto I / Corpus Vasorum Antiquorum Canada, Royal Ontario Museum Toronto, Canada Fascicule 1, Toronto Fascicule 1 (p. 33, no. 1, pl. 39)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.##)
